isis.stitle: FAN DRIVE CLUTCH: KYSOR 1090 (8000 SERIES) - REASSEMBLE - CHECKING OPERATION

svcproc.title: CHECKING OPERATION
svcproc.para: When the fan assembly has been completed, it is important to recheck the clearance before proceeding.

step1.para: Start engine. As air pressure builds up to about 90 psi the clutch will disengage, reducing the fan noise. The compressor governor should be adjusted to cut in no lower than 100 psi. Failure to maintain 100 psi minimum may result in excessive fan clutch wear and possible damage to the engine, fan and radiator.
Stop the engine. With the key switch in the ON position and 90-120 psi of system air, the fan should turn easily by hand. Check for air and water leaks.

Restart the engine and run at governed RPM until the fan clutch has completed one on-off cycle. It may be necessary to block off part of the radiator to achieve enough engine coolant temperature to actuate the fan clutch.
